A Message from Wendy Cary,

Over the past 14 weeks we have served 150 plus families 39,540 meals trying to keep some kind of normalcy in our lives. It was not quite the same without you all here. We miss you and can't wait to have you back in our cafeteria in September.

I personally( Ms. Cary) want to thank the team that I had to do this journey with, I couldn't have done it without you. Thank you to the families who participated in the meal program.

The Cafeteria Staff would like to thank all of the bus drivers for all of their hard work and making sure everyone received their meals, the aides for all of their help as well.

We send a special Thank you to Amy Thetford, Gail Shaw, Brenda Levey Holly Hanks, Kate Geraghty and Kathy Fleming for their dedication and being here everyday helping with the meal preparation. We had lots of laughs but there were some days that was not so much fun. We did it and we Rocked it!

Thank you All,
Salem Central School Food Service Team

The Greenwich Journal and Salem Press
January 20 at 6:44 PM ·

HOW DO YOU GET TO CARNEGIE HALL FROM SALEM? EXCELLENCE.

Local high school musician Lillian Butler has been chosen to sing in the Treble Honor Choir at Carnegie Hall in New York City. A senior at Salem Central School, Lillian has been active in all aspects of vocal music from a young age. School and community musicals, school choral programs, talent shows, performances of her original songs at Caffe Lena in Saratoga, ACDA Honor Choir, NYSSMA solos, New York All-State Chorus, and All-Eastern States Chorus have all prepared Lillian for this special opportunity to sing at Carnegie Hall.

The chorus will begin rehearsals on January 30th under the direction of nationally known choral director, Dr. Timothy Seelig and conclude with a public concert at 8:30 PM on February 2nd. Acceptance into the choir is based on a recorded audition and recommendations.

Lillian is a student of Mr. Zachary Eastman in Salem and has also studied music with Mr. Richard Butler. She is the daughter of Tammy and Richard Butler of Salem, New York.

UPDATE: This morning the district received a walk-up report that there was an individual in camouflage on EAST Broadway walking in the direction of the school carrying a firearm. Out of an abundance of caution and for the safety of our students and staff, we initiated our lock-out procedure and law enforcement was contacted immediately. At the time of the call, New York State Troopers were in Salem and responded to the call. An additional New York State Trooper and deputy from the Washington County Sheriff's department also responded, and indicated that the area was clear. At that point, we returned to our regular school schedule.

A lock-out procedure means all entrances are secured, while allowing instruction to continue in our classrooms. The procedure worked very smoothly thanks to the efforts of the district faculty, staff, and students. Thank you to the New York State Troopers and Washington County Sheriff's Department for the quick response and assistance.

The band is directed by 7-12 music teacher, Mr. Zachary Eastman.

Day of the Dead is a celebration of expression in many ways. We are seeking an Assistant Head Cook!

5.5 hours per day, school day employee.

Responsible for: operation, preparation and presentation of food to students; food ordering; inventory control, and maintain food service equipment.

Qualifications: High school diploma or equivalent. Prior commercial food preparation a plus. Ability to read and follow recipes, determine proportions by weight or volume as well as read and interpret menus. Knowledge in the operation of electric ovens, gas and electric appliances, mixers, steam equipment and various types of cutlery. Hold and maintain appropriate handling and sanitation certification required by NYS Board of Health for food preparation facilities.

Salary: Per Contract

Deadline: Thursday, August 29, 2019

Send letter of interest and resume to:

David Glover, Superintendent
Salem CSD
PO Box 517
Salem, NY 12865
